dfischer.utils

Class SortStringArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.SortStringArray

  • public class SortStringArray
extends java.lang.Object
    Sorts strings in alphabetical order or in random order and support to keep context information about the strings. Note that the methods of this class are not thread-safe.
    See Also:
    SortStringArrayElement.sortAlphabetical(dfischer.utils.SortStringArrayElement[]), SortStringArrayElement.sortByRandom(dfischer.utils.SortStringArrayElement[]), SortStringArrayElement.sortByAddPosition(dfischer.utils.SortStringArrayElement[])

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SortStringArray()
      Create a new instance with no elements.
      SortStringArray(java.lang.String[] sa)
      Create a new instance based on an existing string array.
      SortStringArray(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> v)
      Create a new instance based on an existing vector of strings.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

        public void add(java.lang.String s,
       java.lang.Object context)
        Add a string with a context at the end of the array.
        Parameters:
        s - string to add
        context - the context of the string, or pass null for no context.

      • toArray

        public SortStringArrayElement[] toArray()
        Get the added elements as an array in an unsorted order. Note the elements can be sorted by calling one of the sort methods in SortStringArrayElement.
        See Also:
        SortStringArrayElement.sortAlphabetical(dfischer.utils.SortStringArrayElement[]), SortStringArrayElement.sortByRandom(dfischer.utils.SortStringArrayElement[]), SortStringArrayElement.sortByAddPosition(dfischer.utils.SortStringArrayElement[])
